key_points: Buckingham Palace responds to Meghan and Harry's racism claims made in Oprah interview.
The Queen expresses concern over racism allegations and challenges faced by the couple, but notes recollections may differ.
Statement emphasizes royal family's sadness and intention to address issues privately.
Meghan revealed feeling suicidal and racism claims about concerns over son's skin color.
Crisis talks held among senior royals and aides about fallout from the interview.
The palace had no advance warning of the couple's claims before the broadcast.
The Queen's response suggests a preference for private engagement with the couple.
Royal family to remain tight-knit; Harry, Meghan, and Archie called 'much-loved' family members despite allegations.
Prince Charles and PM Boris Johnson offer no comment on the interview.
Public opinion split on whether the royal family treated Harry and Meghan fairly.
spokespersons: Charles Anson (The Queen's former press secretary)
Alastair Campbell (Tony Blair's former spin doctor)
